intro: Tricalysia davyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually white or purple and bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Tricalysia davyi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
